thread.title: Phillies hire new GM: Shane Victorino talks up Philadelphia to Matt Klentak
thread.title_full: Phillies hire new GM: Shane Victorino talks up Philadelphia to Matt Klentak

author: Randy Miller | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Phillies hire new GM: Shane Victorino talks up Philadelphia to Matt Klentak
text:
Comments 
PHILADELPHIA â€” Matt Klentak started getting a fill on what life can be like for a Phillies GM after news broke last Friday that he'd been hired to take over baseball's worst team. 
Again and again, text messages having been popping up into his phone via the right fielder on the Phillies' 2008 World Series team. Shane Victorino spent the last part of 2015 playing for the Los Angeles Angels, who employed Klentak as assistant GM for the last four seasons. 
"My phone has been blowing up the last few days from Shane Victorino," Klentak said. "He's just through the roof excited." 
What did Victorino have to say? 
"He said, 'Matt, when that team is good and is in the postseason, that place is rocking. There is no better town. You're going to love those fans. Those players. You're going to love everything about that city.'" 
A 35-year-old Massachusetts native who spent the last four seasons as the Los Angeles Angels assistant GM, Klentak probably started getting a feel of what kind of media and fan expectations he'll be dealing with during his news conference. Again and again he asked how long it'll take to build a winner. 
Who can blame Klentak for not pinning down a certain year for an answer? After all, he hadn't even been to his new office yet. 
His knowledge on the Phillies was from studying up for his interviews, although that'll change in a hurry because he headed from Citizens Bank Park to Philadelphia International to fly to Florida for organizational meetings that were scheduled to begin Monday night in Clearwater. 
It already appears that Klentak has a needed Philly-management ingredient. He seems hungry to win. 
"That is ultimately what this is all about," he said. "You know that and I know that. Philadelphia knows that. That's why I'm here. I would not have left Mike Trout in his prime to come here if I didn't believe that. I promise you that. I look forward to contributing and helping this franchise get back to its winning ways." 
Klentak talked a good game his first day on the job. He sounded convincing insisting the Phillies will be winners again, perhaps sooner than some expect. 
"I think the resources that this ownership has committed in the past and has committed to me that they will be committed again in the future is a huge advantage," he said. "There's no question about it. That coupled with ... we will have the largest draft pool. We'll have the largest international pool. There's a lot of inherent advantages that are unique to this situation and also unique to this market. We will do it as fast as humanly possible."
